result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew M Rodriguez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine and DNA surcharge are to be paid at $50 per month commencing 12-01-2016 and the 1st of each month thereafter until paid in full or serve 4 days jail as penalty for failure to pay.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees, completion of treatment (verification to be provided), no new criminal law violations and not prior to 05-15-2017.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
Treatment Letter, received and filed in court.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Barry Braatz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Andrew M Rodriguez in court with attorney Sarah A Ponath.

Defendant enters a plea of No Contest to the charge.
Court finds the defendant Guity of the charge.

Court orders the following:
Fine:  $505 
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $200
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid at the rate of $50 per month, starting 12/01/16 and the 1st of every month until paid in full.
Alternate:  4  Days in the Waukesha County Jail.
  


Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees, completion of treatment (verification to be provided), no new criminal law violations and not prior to 05/15/17.
